sub_title: Senior Advisor Sexual and Reproductive health and Rights at Royal Tropical Insitute (KIT) Associate

profile_positions.description:
Korrie de Koning, M.Sc. Med, is a specialist in public health, education and community development. Her expertise covers a range of areas such as sexual and reproductive health management and education; gender and health; quality assurance; curriculum development and organisation of training. 

Korrie de Koning is a social scientist and educationalist. She was in charge of the international health area in KIT from 2003 till 2010. The area covers 21 expert staff and has a focus on capacity building, knowledge generation and knowledge transfer that is relevant for policy and practice and was course director (1999-2002) of the masters in International Health and Development at KIT. She has worked in Papua New Guinea on the development and management of nutrition interventions and was a lecturer in the International Health division of the Liverpool School of Tropical Medicine (1990-1999). 

Korrie has represented the Dutch government as technical advisor in various capacities and served as a permanent member of the Scientific and Ethical Review Committee of the human reproduction Programme of WHO since 1996 to date. She has extensive experience in research in health, particularly in the area of sexual and reproductive health. She is a specialist in participatory and qualitative research. She carried out research in India, Sierra Leone, Nigeria, Uganda, and the United Kingdom. She is currently project leader for a programme in capacity building for knowledge generation and transfer for improving maternal health in Sierra Leone, and for the linking and learning programme of a collaborative network on public private partnerships to improve maternal and neonatal health. She is also PI for an intervention study on the impact of innovations to improve motivation of health workers and quality of care in sieera leone
profile_positions.title: Senior Advisor Sexual and Reproductive health and Rights
